title: Research
text:
The research of the Quantum Optimization Research Group focuses on the development of advanced optimization algorithms for computationally challenging decision-making problems. Our work is motivated by the growing need for scalable and reliable solution methods for problem classes that arise in engineering design, control, finance, and large-scale systems optimization.
A central theme of our research is the investigation of hybrid quantum–classical computational frameworks, where emerging quantum resources are integrated into well-established classical optimization methods in a principled and theoretically grounded manner.

title: Research
section: Core Problem Class: Mixed-Integer Semidefinite Programming
text:
Core Problem Class: Mixed-Integer Semidefinite Programming
A major focus of the group is Mixed-Integer Semidefinite Programming (MISDP). MISDP problems combine:

Discrete decision variables

Continuous semidefinite constraints

Nonlinear and nonconvex feasible regions

These problems are known to be NP-hard and represent a significant computational bottleneck for existing optimization solvers. Despite their difficulty, MISDP models naturally arise in many real-world applications, including robust control, portfolio optimization, structural design, and systems engineering.
Our research aims to develop algorithmic frameworks that address the intrinsic complexity of MISDP while preserving solution quality and theoretical guarantees.

title: Research
text:
Methodological Framework
The group adopts a decomposition-based approach to tackle MISDP problems. Our methodological toolbox includes:

Semidefinite programming relaxations

Cutting-plane and outer-approximation methods

Branch-and-bound and branch-and-cut frameworks

Problem-specific reformulations and relaxations

These techniques allow large and complex optimization problems to be decomposed into more tractable subproblems, enabling systematic exploration of the solution space.

title: Research
text:
Quantum–Classical Integration
A distinctive aspect of our research is the integration of quantum computational subroutines into classical optimization frameworks. Rather than replacing classical solvers, we investigate how quantum algorithms can be used to accelerate or enhance specific computational components, such as:

Solving structured subproblems

Improving relaxation quality

Enhancing branching or cut-generation strategies

This hybrid perspective ensures that quantum resources are used where they are most effective, while classical optimization methods provide robustness, scalability, and interpretability.

title: Research
text:
Expected Contributions
Our research contributes to both theory and practice by:

Developing novel hybrid quantum–classical optimization algorithms

Advancing the algorithmic understanding of MISDP

Providing rigorous computational benchmarks and performance analyses

Establishing principled guidelines for integrating quantum methods into classical solvers

Through these contributions, the group aims to bridge the gap between emerging quantum technologies and practical large-scale optimization.

title: Join QORE
text:
QORE is looking for motivated graduate students (MSc and PhD) to join our team at Bilkent University. We are looking for students who are passionate about mathematical optimization and emerging technologies.


We welcome applications from students with a strong background in: * Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields. * Mathematical modeling and optimization. * Basic programming skills (e.g., Python, Julia, or C++).
A background in quantum computing is not strictly required, but a strong desire to learn and conduct rigorous research in this area is essential.

title: Join QORE
text:
How to Apply
If you are interested in joining QORE, please send an email to ozbaygin@bilkent.edu.tr with the subject line: “Prospective Student - [Your Name]”.
Please include the following in your email:

A brief introduction explaining your research interests and why you want to work with us.
Your CV, including any relevant projects or publications.
Your transcripts (undergraduate and/or graduate).

title: About
text: QORE (Quantum Operations Research) is a research lab founded at Bilkent University. Our lab is home to a global team of researchers who are experts in various scientific fields. We work at the intersection of optimization theory, computational methods, and emerging quantum technologies.

title: About
text:
Mission
QORE aims to advance the field of optimization by:

Building fast and reliable algorithms to solve complex problems
Bridging classical optimization methods with emerging quantum computational paradigms
Training students in mathematically grounded, algorithm-oriented research
Scientifically contributing to open, reproducible, and high-impact research

We aim to conduct research that is valuable to both the academic community and for solving real-world problems.

title: About
text:
How We Work
At QORE, we do not treat quantum computing as a stand-alone solution. Instead, we study how quantum tools can be integrated into existing mathematical frameworks to solve problems more effectively.
In our research, we prioritize:

Mathematical rigor and clear theoretical foundations.
Smart algorithm design and decomposition.
Computational benchmarking to measure how well our methods perform and scale.

title: About
text:
Collaboration
QORE is a collaborative group. We work with experts across different disciplines, participate in national and international projects and welcome partnerships with both academic and industrial partners.

title: About
text:
Where We Are
QORE is based in the Department of Industrial Engineering at Bilkent University, one of the leading research universities in Turkey. Bilkent provides a strong interdisciplinary research environment and access to a vibrant academic community.

title: Welcome to QORE
text: QORE (Quantum Operations Research) is a research lab based in Bilkent University. We develop new methods to solve complex problems by combining classical optimization with quantum approaches to investigate where quantum technology has the potential to provide a real advantage.

title: Welcome to QORE
text:
What We Do
We focus on developing and testing hybrid quantum-classical algorithms to address challenges in decision science and mathematical optimization that are difficult for traditional computers to handle alone.

title: Welcome to QORE
text:
Research Focus
Our primary work lies in mixed-integer optimization, which is a broad family of optimization problems found in numerous application areas, including:

Logistics and Transportation
Finance and Risk Management
Power Systems

We study how and when quantum algorithmic components can enhance the solution of mixed-integer optimization problems.

title: Welcome to QORE
text:
Our Approach
In our lab, we aim to bridge the gap between theory and practice by focusing on:

Hybrid Algorithm Design: Combining the strengths of both classical and quantum computing.
Smart Frameworks: Developing new ways to break down and solve mixed-integer problems.
Computational Testing: Using rigorous benchmarking to explore the performance and scalability of our methods.
